body: You shouldn't really ever call html_safe in your helpers, you should create a new SafeBuffer and append to it. It's uglier to read but it's much much much safer. As for this change, it's harmless unless someone can think of a case where you'd want the unsafe strings. There's no security reason not to change this. On 16/06/2013, at 2:26 AM, "Rafael Mendonça França" < notifications@github.com> wrote: @dtaniwaki avoid to call .html_safe on string interpolations using helpers. def do_something(condtion) "Do something with ".html_safe + link_to_unless(condition, 'x', 'github.com')end Should give the same result and do_something(true) will not have the bold text — Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub .
